profileAlternative.name: Howard Hinnant
profileAlternative.headline: Senior Software Developer at Ripple
profileAlternative.summary:
Implemented an independent implementation of the C++11 standard library which is now open sourced: http://libcxx.llvm.org/
which is now being used on several desktop and embedded platforms across the industry.

Instrumental in getting the rvalue reference feature into C++11 which enables "move semantics": http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2002/n1377.htm.

I've been an active member of the C++ standards committee since 1998. From Oct. 2005 to Aug. 2010 I served as the Library Working Group Chairman.

Co-Implemented independent implementation of the C++ Itanium ABI to support the llvm libcxx project: http://libcxxabi.llvm.org
This involves low-level code which implements exception handling, dynamic_casts and other runtime support.

Single handedly wrote independent implementation of the C++03 standard library for Metrowerks. The library includes many optimizations geared towards embedded environments (e.g. Palm, Sony PlayStation 2, Nintendo GameCube, ARM, PPC, 68K, etc.).

Specialties: C++ library design, documentation, testing and support. Expert in template meta-programming. Experienced in the standardization process for computer languages.

positions.title: Senior Software Engineer
positions.description:
Provided Apple with C++ standard library implementation and customer support.

Represents Apple at the C++ Standards Meetings (biannual). Member ANSI J16 / ISO WG21. Served as Library Working Group Chairman 2005-2010. Responsible for overseeing the interests of Apple.

positions.title: Senior Library Engineer
positions.companyName: Freescale, formerly Metrowerks a subsidiary of Motorola
positions.description:
Provide complete product delivery and support for the Metrowerks implementation of the standard C++ library (MSL C++). This includes a complete and independent implementation of the C++ standard (chapters 17-27), with special optimizations for higher performance and lower code size (motivated by embedded systems) not seen on any other implementation. This library also includes many Metrowerks custom extensions. Duties include writing unit tests for these libraries, documentation, and customer support.

Represents Freescale at the C++ Standards Meetings (biannual). Member ANSI J16 / ISO WG21. Served as Library Working Group Chairman. Responsible for overseeing the interests of Metrowerks, implementing changes in the standard in MSL C++, and writing proposals to improve the C++ language.

positions.title: Senior Scientist
positions.description:
Key member of a small team which brought a software project from an early alpha stage to a commercial release. This project, written mostly in C++, was a unique tool for solving partial differential equations. Unlike traditional codes, it was not specialized to a specific equation, and was thus widely applicable. We demonstrated applications in elasticity, electrodynamics, thermals, fluids, chemistry and finance. Involved both symbolic and numerical computation.

positions.title: U.S. Army Research Laboratory
positions.description:
Co-located with NASA Langley, fully integrated in with NASA organization.

Involved in the development of sparse, positive definite solvers for use in finite element codes. Explored the use of C++ as a replacement language for high performance numerical work, (typically done in Fortran at the time).

Used shape optimization with the finite element method to redesign flight critical component on a fielded military rotorcraft, reducing peak stresses and subsequently increasing the lifetime and safety of this component. This redesign was in response to several catastrophic failures, some of which unfortunately resulted in fatalities.

Explored advanced finite element techniques including "p-version" elements, and new element quadrature techniques.

given.text: Working with Andreas has been a rare privilege. The quality and speed with which Andreas responds to requests and problems is extraordinary. I've had the opportunity to work across several industries and companies, and if I were building an "A Team" to execute an impossible task today, I'd want Andreas on it.

Josef has an amazing ability to master many different domains. I've worked with Josef for nearly 8 years now, and I am continually impressed with his ability to move in and solve problems with a minimum of bureaucratic Mickey Mouse. Just a simple "Problem's solved. What's next?"
